poem:
"Of Memory and Loss"

Once vibrant minds,
Entwined in the dance of life,
A misstep, a falter.
Brain cells burst, beauty
In collapse. 
The pituitary - a trembling traitor,
Freighted with another's forgetting.
Broadcasting to neurons,
Not virus or fear,
But the profoundest of endings,
The quietest of goodbyes.
Who will remember the rememberer,
When memories fly away as autumn leaves?
